intro: Lucinaea monocephala, commonly known as the single-headed woodbine, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, fragrant white or pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Lucinaea monocephala is typically found in woodland areas and thrives in partial shade.
